hacks.title: The Mattress Run Strategy
hacks.summary: Book cheap hotel nights just for elite night credits â€” without actually staying.

content.what: A 'mattress run' is booking hotel stays purely to earn elite qualifying nights, often without actually sleeping there.
content.why: When you're a few nights short of reaching or maintaining elite status, spending $100-200 on cheap rooms can unlock benefits worth $1000+.
steps: Calculate how many nights you need for next tier
Find cheapest properties in your program (airport hotels, secondary markets)
Book consecutive nights at end of qualifying period
Check in (some allow mobile check-in from anywhere)
Enjoy your elite status for another year
pro_tips: Airport hotels often cheapest and don't care if you're there
Some credit cards give you automatic elite nights
Combine with promotions for bonus points too
warnings: Use sparingly to avoid account review
Never book rooms you can't technically cancel if needed

hacks.title: The Southwest Companion Pass Shortcut
hacks.summary: Earn a Companion Pass (BOGO flights for 2 years) in under 3 months.

content.what: The Companion Pass lets a designated person fly with you for FREE (just taxes) on every Southwest flight for up to 2 years.
steps: Apply for both Southwest personal cards (Priority + Plus/Premier)
Do this in January for maximum 23 months of value

hacks.title: The Fifth Night Free Stack
hacks.summary: Get 20% off any 5+ night hotel stay automatically.

content.what: Marriott, Hyatt, and IHG all offer a free night when booking 5+ nights with points.
content.calculation: 5 nights but only pay for 4 = 20% instant savings
content.optimization: Always book in 5-night chunks when possible, even if you're staying 6 nights (book 5, book 1)
